description: Player-initiated camp decisions linked to orchestrated opportunities

events.title: Maintain Your Gear
events.setup: Oil, polish, sharpen. Keep it battle-ready. A soldier's gear is his life.

options.resultText: You work methodically - cleaning rust, sharpening edges, oiling leather. Your gear is ready for whatever comes.
Your gear will survive another day. Probably.

events.title: Write a Letter Home
events.setup: Ink, paper, and memories of another life. Someone back home might appreciate hearing from you.

options.text: Write a reassuring letter, downplaying the dangers.
options.resultText: You craft careful words of safety and good fortune. No need to worry those waiting for you. The courier takes your letter with the next dispatch.
The truth flows onto the page - the fear, the boredom, the moments of strange pride. It feels good to be honest, even if the words might worry them.
You set aside the paper. Another time.

events.title: High Stakes Game
events.setup: Real money. Real risk. The kind of game where fortunes change hands.

options.text: Put real money on the table.
options.resultText: Fortune favors the bold! You rake in a substantial pot. The losers eye you with new respect.
options.failure_resultText: The dice betray you. Your stake is gone. The winners smirk as you count what's left.
options.tooltip: 45% to win 150 gold. +3 Soldier rep. Costs 50 gold.

options.resultText: You keep your gold in your purse. Wisdom, or cowardice? Only you know.

events.title: Access Baggage Train
events.setup: The baggage wagons are accessible. Time to check your belongings.

options.resultText: You rummage through your belongings.
Your belongings can wait.

events.title: Weapon Drill
events.setup: The sergeant calls for formation. Men line up with their weapons, ready to drill.

options.text: Focus on your form. Train hard.
options.resultText: Sweat runs down your back. Your arms ache. But your blade feels more natural now.

options.text: Go through the motions. Chat with the lads.
options.resultText: You learn a few names, share a few jokes. The sergeant frowns but says nothing.
You slip away before the sergeant notices.

events.title: Sparring Match
events.setup: A soldier tosses you a practice sword. The crowd forms a rough circle. Time to show what you've got.

options.resultText: You drive him back with a flurry of blows. He yields with a grudging nod. The watching men mutter approval.
options.failure_resultText: He reads your aggression and counters. You eat dirt. A lesson in humility.

options.resultText: You keep your guard tight, watching his footwork. The match ends in a draw, but you've learned something.
options.tooltip: +3 One-Handed XP. Costs 2 fatigue. Safe choice.

options.resultText: You toss the practice sword back. Another time.

events.title: Formation Practice
events.setup: The sergeants are putting men through their paces. Shield walls, cavalry charges, the basics of staying alive in a battle line.

options.resultText: Shoulder to shoulder with the line. Shield up, spear out. The rhythm of it becomes instinct.
Advance, wheel, reform. The company moves as one. You're starting to see how battles are won.
You find somewhere else to be.

events.title: Veteran's Lesson
events.setup: The grizzled veteran eyes you appraisingly. He's fought more battles than you've seen winters. Some lessons are only taught with bruises.

options.resultText: He doesn't pull his blows. By the end you're bruised and aching, but you understand things you didn't before. Some lessons are written in pain.
You watch how he moves, how he reads his opponent. Some lessons are in the seeing.
He shrugs and turns away. His lessons aren't for everyone.

events.title: Archery Range
events.setup: Straw targets behind the wagons. A few archers are loosing arrows, correcting each other's form. There's room for one more.

options.resultText: Nock, draw, release. The rhythm becomes familiar. Your groupings tighten with each round.
Your arrow finds center. The small pot of coin is yours.
options.failure_resultText: Close, but not close enough. The winner grins as he collects.
options.tooltip: 40% to win 50 gold. +3 Bow XP. Costs 10 gold, 2 fatigue.

options.resultText: The bow's not calling today.

events.title: War Stories
events.setup: Old veterans gathered around a fire, sharing tales of battles past. A few younger soldiers listen with wide eyes.

options.resultText: Tales of sieges and charges, of men who lived and men who didn't. You learn names, faces, the weight of shared history.
You tell your piece. They listen. By the end, you're one of them.
You pass by the fire without stopping.

events.title: Sutler's Tent
events.setup: Cheap wine and cheaper conversation. The sutler's tent is doing good business tonight.

options.resultText: The wine is sour but the company's good. You relax, share a laugh, feel almost human again.
The night becomes a blur of laughter and song. You'll regret this in the morning, but for now, nothing matters.
options.tooltip: +2 Soldier rep. -4 fatigue. +1 Scrutiny. Costs 25 gold.

options.resultText: You pass by the tent. Clear heads are useful.

events.title: Storytelling Circle
events.setup: A circle has formed around the fire. One of the older soldiers is telling a tale, voice rising and falling with practiced ease.

options.resultText: You find a spot and settle in. The tale carries you away from camp, from war, from everything but the firelight.
The firelight fades behind you.

events.title: Drinking Contest
events.setup: A ring of soldiers watch two men each gripping a mug. The cheering is loud. Someone is about to lose their supper, and possibly their wages.

options.resultText: The crowd roars. Your opponent slumps. You barely remember the last round, but you won. Somehow.
options.failure_resultText: The world spins. You lose spectacularly. At least the men have a good laugh at your expense.
options.tooltip: 35% to win 80 gold and +3 rep. Costs 20 gold, 2 fatigue, +1 Scrutiny.

options.resultText: You cheer from the sidelines. Safer this way.

events.title: Campfire Songs
events.setup: Someone's found a lute. The singing is terrible but enthusiastic. Soldiers clap along, forgetting tomorrow's march.

options.resultText: Your voice joins the chorus. Off-key but heartfelt. For a moment, you're not soldiers - just men around a fire.
You appreciate the music from a distance.

events.title: Arm Wrestling
events.setup: Two burly soldiers have locked hands across a barrel. Coins are being wagered. The bigger one looks unbeatable, but sometimes technique wins.

options.resultText: His hand slams down. The crowd erupts. You've won more than coin - you've won respect.
options.failure_resultText: Your arm buckles. He grins. The crowd laughs. Next time.
options.tooltip: 45% to win 40 gold and +2 rep. Costs 15 gold, 1 fatigue.

options.resultText: You stay in the crowd. Safer bet.

events.title: Card Game
events.setup: A modest game near the cook fires. The stakes are low, the company good. A way to pass the time.

options.text: Sit in for a few hands.
options.resultText: Fortune smiles. You collect a modest pot and more importantly, you've had a good time.
options.failure_resultText: The cards aren't with you tonight. You lose your stake but enjoy the company.
options.tooltip: 50% to win 25 gold. +1 Soldier rep. Costs 10 gold.

options.resultText: You watch a hand or two before moving on.

events.title: Dice Game
events.setup: Behind the supply wagons, men crouch in the dust. Dice rattle. Higher stakes than the card players.

options.resultText: The dice favor you. Coins pile before you as the others curse their luck.
options.failure_resultText: The dice are cold. You walk away lighter in the purse.
options.tooltip: 40% to win 75 gold. +1 Scrutiny. Costs 25 gold.

options.resultText: You resist the temptation. For now.

events.title: Foraging Party
events.setup: A small party is heading out to supplement rations. There might be something extra in it for those who volunteer.

options.resultText: Hours of tramping through woods and fields. You return tired but carrying something for the cookpots. The sergeant nods approval.
options.tooltip: +4 Scouting XP. +1 Officer rep. Costs 3 fatigue.

options.resultText: You've got other things to do.

events.title: Repair Work
events.setup: The quartermaster needs hands for repairs. Wagon wheels, tent patches, harness mending. Paid work for those willing.

options.resultText: Honest work. Your hands are rough by the end, but there's coin in your pouch and the quartermaster remembers who helps.
The quartermaster finds someone else.

events.title: Merchant Caravan
events.setup: A merchant caravan has arrived with goods from distant lands. Some soldiers are already haggling.

options.resultText: You learn what things cost, what's rare, what's common. Useful knowledge for a soldier far from home.
A small luxury. Something to remind you that life isn't just marching and fighting.
You admire but don't buy. Smart soldier.

events.title: Rest
events.setup: Your bedroll looks inviting. A few hours of proper rest would do you good.

options.resultText: You sleep deeply. When you wake, the world feels slightly less crushing.
You push through. Sleep can wait.

events.title: Help the Wounded
events.setup: The camp surgeon could use another pair of hands. The wounded need water and bandages changed.

options.resultText: Blood and bandages. The work is grim but the men you help look at you with gratitude. You learn the shape of wounds and how to tend them.
options.tooltip: +5 Medicine XP. +2 Soldier rep. Costs 2 fatigue.

options.resultText: The surgeon finds another helper.

events.title: Prayer Service
events.setup: The camp priest is holding a small service. A handful of soldiers kneel in quiet contemplation.

options.resultText: You kneel with the others. The words wash over you. For a moment, the war seems far away.
Faith is a private thing.

events.title: Quick Rest
events.setup: An old oak provides rare shade from the sun. A few soldiers are dozing against its trunk. There's room for one more.

options.text: Close your eyes for a bit.
options.resultText: You wedge yourself against the roots and drift off. When you stir, the shadows have moved but you feel lighter.
You push on.

events.title: Quiet Reflection
events.setup: A quiet spot behind the camp. The chaos fades to a distant murmur. Time to gather your thoughts.

options.resultText: You breathe. The noise fades. For a time, there is only stillness.
The camp calls you back.

events.title: Officer's Audience
events.setup: The captain is receiving soldiers with complaints or requests. A rare chance to be heard.

options.resultText: The captain listens, makes a note. No promises, but you've been heard. Whether that means anything remains to be seen.
options.tooltip: -2 Officer rep. May improve future equipment access.

options.resultText: The captain nods with approval. Volunteers are remembered. For better or worse, you're on his list now.
You step out of line. Maybe next time.

events.title: Mentor a Recruit
events.setup: A young recruit is struggling with basic drill movements. His sergeant looks frustrated. A helping hand might earn some goodwill.

options.resultText: You walk him through the movements, correct his stance, show him the rhythm. By the end, he's not perfect, but he's better. The sergeant nods thanks.
options.tooltip: +2 Soldier rep. +1 Officer rep. +4 Leadership XP. Costs 1 fatigue.

options.resultText: The recruit will have to figure it out himself.

events.title: Extra Duty
events.setup: The sergeant is looking for volunteers for an extra watch. It's thankless work, but the officers will notice who steps up.

options.resultText: Long hours in the dark, watching nothing happen. But the sergeant remembers who showed up when he asked.
You've done your share.

events.title: Night Patrol
events.setup: A few soldiers are heading out to check the perimeter. It's not official duty, just men who can't sleep. Sometimes they find things worth finding.

options.resultText: You find something - a lost coin pouch, dropped by some careless soldier. Finders keepers.
options.failure_resultText: Nothing but stars and silence. But the walk clears your head.
options.tooltip: 30% to find 25 gold. +4 Scouting XP. +1 Soldier rep. Costs 2 fatigue.

options.resultText: The night is cold. You stay by the fire.

events.title: Deck Training
events.setup: Veterans gather on the foredeck at dawn. The ship rolls but they keep their footing. Time to learn balance fighting.

options.resultText: The deck pitches and rolls. Your legs burn from constant adjustment. But you're learning to fight on an unstable surface.
options.tooltip: +5 One-Handed XP. +3 Athletics XP. Costs 2 fatigue.

options.text: Go through the motions. Chat with the lads.
options.resultText: The veterans share sea-fighting tricks between swings. You learn a few names, share a few jokes about landlubbers.

options.text: Your stomach isn't ready for that.
options.resultText: You grip the rail and let the wave of nausea pass.

events.title: Shipboard Sparring
events.setup: Two soldiers circle each other on the rolling deck. The crowd forms a rough ring. Fighting on a ship is different.

options.text: Fight aggressively. Use the ship's motion.
options.resultText: The ship rolls and you ride it, driving forward when the deck tilts your way. He stumbles. You win.
options.failure_resultText: The deck drops from under you mid-swing. You sprawl across the planking. Lesson learned.

options.text: Stay balanced. Learn the ship's rhythm.
options.resultText: You keep your knees bent, weight centered. The match ends in a draw, but you've learned to read the waves.
options.tooltip: +3 One-Handed XP. +2 Athletics XP. Costs 2 fatigue. Safe choice.

options.resultText: You're not ready to fight on a moving floor.

events.title: Salt's Lesson
events.setup: The old sailor - they call him Salt - has fought more sea battles than you've had hot meals. He's willing to teach, but his lessons are hard.

options.resultText: He throws you around the deck for an hour. 'Keep your weight low. The sea fights for the man who respects her.' By the end you're bruised but wiser.
options.tooltip: +6 One-Handed XP. +4 Athletics XP. -5 HP. Costs 3 fatigue.

options.resultText: He moves like the deck is part of him. Every roll becomes a step, every pitch a feint. Some lessons are in the seeing.
He shrugs and turns away. 'Landlubber.'

events.title: Visit the Hold
events.setup: The cargo hold is accessible between watches. Your personal effects are stowed below deck.

options.resultText: Everything's secure and dry. The ship's crew know how to stow cargo properly. A small comfort.
It can wait until port.

events.title: Sea Tales
events.setup: Old hands gathered by the mainmast, sharing tales of storms and sea battles. A few younger soldiers listen with wide eyes.

options.resultText: Tales of terrible storms, of ships that vanished, of sea monsters and ghost vessels. You learn names, faces, the weight of shared voyages.

options.text: Share a tale of your own.
options.resultText: You tell your piece. They listen. By the end, you're part of the crew.
You pass by the mainmast without stopping.

events.title: Sea Shanties
events.setup: Someone's started a shanty. The rhythm matches the work - hauling lines, scrubbing decks. The singing is rough but keeps time.

options.resultText: Your voice joins the chorus. 'Heave away, haul away!' For a moment, you're not soldiers on a ship - just sailors under the sky.
You appreciate the music from a distance.

events.title: Ship's Grog
events.setup: Grog ration's been issued. Some men are trading their share, others are drinking deep. The ship's stores have rum tonight.

options.resultText: The grog is rough but warming. You share a laugh with the crew, feel almost human again.
The night becomes a blur of sea songs and swaying hammocks. You'll regret this when they call for watch.
options.tooltip: +2 Soldier rep. -4 fatigue. +1 Scrutiny. Costs 15 gold.

options.resultText: You trade it for something useful. Clear heads are valuable at sea.

events.title: Below-Decks Dice
events.setup: Between the cargo and the bilge, men crouch with lanterns and dice. The ship's motion makes every roll uncertain.

options.resultText: The dice favor you. Coins pile before you as the others curse the ship's roll.
options.failure_resultText: The dice bounce wrong. You walk away lighter in the purse.
options.tooltip: 40% to win 75 gold. +1 Scrutiny. Costs 25 gold.

options.resultText: You resist the temptation. For now.

events.title: Hammock Rest
events.setup: Your hammock sways with the ship. The rhythm is almost soothing once you get used to it.

options.resultText: You sleep deeply, swaying with the sea. When you wake, the world feels slightly less crushing.

options.text: Can't sleep. Too much going on.
options.resultText: You push through. Sleep can wait until port.

events.title: Ship Repairs
events.setup: The bosun needs hands for repairs. Rope splicing, sail patching, tar and oakum. Paid work for those willing.

options.resultText: Honest work. Your hands are rough from the rope by the end, but there's coin in your pouch and the bosun remembers who helps.
The bosun finds another pair of hands.

events.title: Night Watch Volunteer
events.setup: The lookouts are tired. Volunteers to help scan the horizon are always welcome. Sometimes you spot things worth spotting.

options.resultText: You spot something - flotsam from a wreck. The captain has it recovered. Finders get a share.
options.failure_resultText: Nothing but stars and waves. But the quiet clears your head.
options.tooltip: 30% to find 25 gold. +4 Scouting XP. +1 Soldier rep. Costs 2 fatigue.

options.resultText: The night is cold. You stay below.

events.title: Help the Seasick
events.setup: Half the soldiers are green and miserable. The ship's surgeon could use hands to help them keep water down.

options.resultText: Buckets and blankets. The work is grim but the men you help look at you with gratitude. You learn what settles a stomach.
options.tooltip: +5 Medicine XP. +2 Soldier rep. Costs 2 fatigue.

options.resultText: The surgeon finds another helper.
